info.title: Kanidm
info.description: API for interacting with the Kanidm system. This is a work in progress.

get.summary: Status endpoint used for health checks, returns true when the server is up.
This returns the image for the OAuth2 Resource Server if the user has permissions

post.summary: API endpoint for creating/replacing the image associated with an OAuth2 Resource Server.
post.description:
It requires a multipart form with the image file, and the content type must be one of the
[VALID_IMAGE_UPLOAD_CONTENT_TYPES].

get.summary: Returns all groups visible  to the user
Lists all the OAuth2 Resource Servers

post.summary: Create a new Confidential OAuth2 client that authenticates with Http Basic.
Create a new Public OAuth2 client

get.summary: Get the details of a given OAuth2 Resource Server.
Get the basic secret for a given OAuth2 Resource Server. This is used for authentication.

post.summary: Modify the claim map join strategy for a given OAuth2 Resource Server
Modify the claim map for a given OAuth2 Resource Server
API endpoint for creating/replacing the image associated with an OAuth2 Resource Server.
post.description:
It requires a multipart form with the image file, and the content type must be one of the
[VALID_IMAGE_UPLOAD_CONTENT_TYPES].

post.summary: Modify the scope map for a given OAuth2 Resource Server
Create a supplemental scope map for a given OAuth2 Resource Server
Expects the following fields in the attrs field of the req: [name, displayname]
Expects the following fields in the attrs field of the req: [certificate]

post.summary:
Due to how the migrations work in 6 -> 7, we can accidentally
mark "accounts" as service accounts when they are persons. This
allows migrating them to the person type due to its similarities.

get.summary: Get the details of a sync account

AccountUnixExtend.description: Request addition of unix attributes to an account

shell.description: The internal attribute is "loginshell" but we use shell in the API currently

ApiTokenGenerate.description: A request to generate a new API token for a service account

AppLink.description:
This is a description of a linked or connected application for a user. This is
used in the UI to render applications on the dashboard for a user to access.

oneOf.description: An LDAP Compatible emailAddress
An LDAP Compatible sshkeys virtual attribute
A set of scim schemas. This is similar to a kanidm class.
An LDAP-compatible sshpublickey
The Kanidm-local ssh_publickey

AuthAllowed.description:
A challenge containing the list of allowed authentication types
that can satisfy the next step. These may have inner types with
required context.

AuthCredential.description: The credential challenge provided by a user.

AuthIssueSession.description: The type of session that should be issued to the client.

AuthMech.description: The mechanisms that may proceed in this authentication

AuthRequest.description: A request for the next step of an authentication.

oneOf.description: You need to select how you want to proceed.

choose.description: You need to select how you want to proceed.

oneOf.description: Continue to auth, allowed mechanisms/challenges listed.

continue.description: Continue to auth, allowed mechanisms/challenges listed.

oneOf.description: Something was bad, your session is terminated and no cookie.

denied.description: Something was bad, your session is terminated and no cookie.

oneOf.description: Everything is good, your bearer token has been issued and is within.

success.description: Everything is good, your bearer token has been issued and is within.

AuthState.description: The response to an AuthStep request.

oneOf.description: Initialise a new authentication session

Initialise a new authentication session with extra flags
for requesting different types of session tokens or
immediate access to privileges.

init2.description:
Initialise a new authentication session with extra flags
for requesting different types of session tokens or
immediate access to privileges.

privileged.description: If true, the session will have r/w access.

oneOf.description: Request the named authentication mechanism to proceed

begin.description: Request the named authentication mechanism to proceed

oneOf.description: Provide a credential in response to a challenge

cred.description: Provide a credential in response to a challenge

AuthStep.description:
Authentication to Kanidm is a stepped process.

The session is first initialised with the requested username.

In response the list of supported authentication mechanisms is provided.

The user chooses the authentication mechanism to proceed with.

The server responds with a challenge that the user provides a credential
to satisfy. This challenge and response process continues until a credential
fails to validate, an error occurs, or successful authentication is complete.

oneOf.description: totp, webauthn

Entry.description: A limited view of an entry in Kanidm.

GroupUnixExtend.description: Request addition of unix attributes to a group.

oneOf.description:
when you ask for a gid that overlaps a system reserved range
When a name is denied by the system config

When the DB is potentially over-loaded a timeout can occur starting
your operation.
Your change would introduce a reference loop

SchemaJwk.description: Used entirely to trick Utoipa into generating the correct schema for JWK

ScimEntryGetQuery.description: SCIM Query Parameters used during the get of a single entry

allOf.description: Create an attribute to contain the following value state.

Non-standard extension - allow query options to be set in a put request. This
is because a put request also returns the entry state post put, so we want
to allow putters to adjust and control what is returned here.

additionalProperties.description:
Update an attribute to contain the following value state.
If the attribute is None, it is removed.

oneOf.description:
No actions are to be taken - only update or create entries in the
entries set.

All entries that have their uuid present in this set are retained.
Anything not present will be deleted.

Retain.description:
All entries that have their uuid present in this set are retained.
Anything not present will be deleted.

oneOf.description:
Any entry with its UUID in this set will be deleted. Anything not
present will be retained.

Delete.description:
Any entry with its UUID in this set will be deleted. Anything not
present will be retained.

issuer.description: User-facing name of the system, issuer of the TOTP

expiry.description:
If none, there is no expiry, and this is always rw. If there is
an expiry, check that the current time < expiry.

UatPurposeStatus.description:
The current purpose of a User Auth Token. It may be read-only, read-write
or privilege capable (able to step up to read-write after re-authentication).

UatStatus.description: The status of a User Auth Token

UatStatusState.description: The expiry of the User Auth Token.

UnixGroupToken.description: A token representing the details of a unix group

UnixUserToken.description: A token representing the details of a unix user

UserAuthToken.description:
The currently authenticated user, and any required metadata for them
to properly authorise them. This is similar in nature to oauth and the krb
PAC/PAD structures. This information is transparent to clients and CAN
be parsed by them!

This structure and how it works will *very much* change over time from this
point onward! This means on updates, that sessions will invalidate in many
cases.

expiry.description:
If none, there is no expiry, and this is always valid. If there is
an expiry, check that the current time < expiry.

oneOf.description: Something went wrong when doing things.

OperationError.description: Something went wrong when doing things.

WebError.description: The web app's top level error type, this takes an `OperationError` and converts it into a HTTP response.

WhoamiResponse.description: A response to a whoami request
